body_html:
@kinderry Thanks for the hint with the other issue, but it seems to be a completely different topic.
Here, I use a relative pathname. This means tensorboard is indeed started from the same drive, it is even started from the parent directory of the summary-dir. And furthermore all data are shown, except of the graph.

@kinderry Thanks for the hint with the other issue, but it seems to be a completely different topic.
Here, I use a relative pathname. This means tensorboard is indeed started from the same drive, it is even started from the parent directory of the summary-dir. And furthermore all data are shown, except of the graph.
body:
@kinderry Thanks for the hint with the other issue, but it seems to be a completely different topic. 
Here, I use a relative pathname. This means tensorboard is indeed started from the same drive, it is even started from the parent directory of the summary-dir. And furthermore all data are shown, except of the graph.
